text: Mark George Miller (born August 13, 1956) is a former American football quarterback. He played with the Cleveland Browns (1978–1979) before being traded in August 1980 to the Green Bay Packers, where he saw no action. Miller then briefly resurfaced with the Michigan Panthers of the United States Football League in 1983. Miller had put together a solid college career with Bowling Green State University (1974–1977), resulting in the Browns making him a third round selection in the 1978 NFL Draft. During his brief career his role was that of a backup quarterback, consequently making his playing time limited.
